intro: Tragacantha scabriseta, commonly known as the hairy tragacanth, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by pods containing several seeds. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments due to its deep root system. The hairy tragacanth is also valued for its gelatinous exudate, which has been used in traditional medicine and as a thickening agent.
